title: Dutchwoman Annemiek van Vleuten produces stunning solo ride to clinch first world road race title
text:
It will surprise nobody to have seen a Dutchwoman take the top step of the podium, but few will have predicted the nature in which Annemiek van Vleuten was crowned world champion.

It was a brilliantly brave performance and a tactical masterclass from the Dutch team, who stole the rainbow jersey in plain sight of their rivals.

The victory for Van Vleuten came after 4hr 6min 5sec of racing, an astonishing 2:15 faster than Anna van der Breggen, who made it a Dutch one-two, Australia’s Amanda Spratt completed the podium in third.

Just 12 months after crashing out at the world championships in Innsbruck, where she broke her knee, the 36-year-old Van Vleuten was finally crowned world road champion.

“This is the most special win [of my career],” Van Vleuten said. “After last year in Innsbruck, the disappointment I had there. I couldn’t celebrate my world title in the time trial at all after breaking my knee. I can enjoy it now.”
description: It will surprise nobody to have seen a Dutchwoman take the top step of the podium, but few will have predicted the nature in which Annemiek van Vleuten was crowned world champion.
